trans-unit.source: Supports installing and removing the SQL Server database elements of ASP.NET features.
You can use SQL Server databases to store information for ASP.NET features such as session state, membership, Web parts personalization, and role management.
These features require that the SQL Server database to which they are connected be properly configured before use.
You can use the ASP.NET Register SQL tool (aspnet_regsql.exe) to do this, or you can call the static methods exposed by the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> class directly from your code.

Using the aspnet_regsql.exe tool or the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> class to configure the database only sets up the database that the providers will use with the proper tables, triggers, and stored procedures.
Configuring the database in this way does not modify configuration files to specify that these features use the SQL Providers for these services.
Generates the SQL scripts for the selected features.
The scripts will reference the database indicated by the database parameter.
`true` to generate a script that installs the specified features; `false` to generate a script that removes the features.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures"></xref> values, specifying the specific features for which to generate scripts.
The name of the SQL Server database to use in the generated scripts.
Returns the generated script code.
Generates the SQL script for installing or removing session state.
The script will reference the database indicated by the database parameter.
`true` to generate a script that installs the specified features; `false` to generate a script that removes the features.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SessionStateType"></xref> values, specifying the type of session state for which to generate scripts.
The name of the SQL Server database to use in the generated scripts.
Returns the generated script code.
The type is `Custom` and the customDatabase value is not supplied, or the type is either `Temporary` or `Persisted` and the customDatabase value is not null.
Installs components for selected ASP.NET features on a SQL Server database.
If `database` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default database, `aspnetdb`.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The database server on which to install the features.
The database on which to install the features.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures"></xref> values, specifying the features to install.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
The features value contains one or more invalid flags.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Installs components for selected ASP.NET services on a SQL Server database.
If `database` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default database, `aspnetdb`.
The database on which to install the features.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures"></xref> values, specifying the features to install.
The connection string to use.
The connection string is only used to establish a connection to the database server.
Specifying a database in the connection string has no effect.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
The features value contains one or more invalid flags.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Installs components for selected ASP.NET features on a SQL Server database.
If `database` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default database, `aspnetdb`.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The database server on which to install the features.
The user name to use when connecting to the database.
The password to use when connecting to the database.
The database on which to install the features.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures"></xref> values, specifying the features to install.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
The features value contains one or more invalid flags.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Installs components for ASP.NET session state on a SQL Server database.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The SQL Server instance on which to install the session-state components.
The database on which to install the session-state components.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SessionStateType"></xref> values, specifying the type of session state to install.
The type is `Custom` and the customDatabase value is not supplied, or the type is either `Temporary` or `Persisted` and the customDatabase value is not null.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Installs components for ASP.NET session state on a SQL Server database.
The database on which to install the session-state components.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SessionStateType"></xref> values, specifying the type of session state to install.
The connection string to use.
The connection string is only used to establish a connection to the database server.
Specifying a database in the connection string has no effect.
The type is `Custom` and the customDatabase value is not supplied, or the type is either `Temporary` or `Persisted` and the customDatabase value is not null.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Installs components for ASP.NET session state on a SQL Server database.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The SQL Server instance on which to install the session-state components.
The user name to use when connecting to the database.
The password to use when connecting to the database.
The database on which to install the session-state components.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SessionStateType"></xref> values, specifying the type of session state to install.
The type is `Custom` and the customDatabase value is not supplied, or the type is either `Temporary` or `Persisted` and the customDatabase value is not null.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Removes components for selected ASP.NET features from a SQL Server database.
If `database` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default database, `aspnetdb`.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The SQL Server instance from which to remove the features.
The database from which to remove the features.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures"></xref> values, specifying the features to remove.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
The features value contained one or more invalid flags.

An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation, an attempt was made to uninstall from a nonexistent database, or one or more tables for the features in the specified database contained data.
Removes components for selected ASP.NET features from a SQL Server database.
If `database` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default database `aspnetdb`.
The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The database from which to remove the features.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures"></xref> values, specifying the features to remove.
The connection string to use.
The connection string is only used to establish a connection to the database server.
Specifying a database in the connection string has no effect.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
The features value contained one or more invalid flags.

An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation, an attempt was made to uninstall from a nonexistent database, or one or more tables for the features in the specified database contained data.
Removes components for selected ASP.NET features from a SQL Server database.
If `database` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default database, `aspnetdb`.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The SQL Server instance from which to remove the features.
The user name to use when connecting to the database.
The password to use when connecting to the database.
The database from which to remove the features.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures"></xref> values, specifying the features to remove.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
The features value contained one or more invalid flags.

An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation, an attempt was made to uninstall from a nonexistent database, or one or more tables for the features in the specified database contained data.
Removes components for ASP.NET session state from a SQL Server database.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
**Note** The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The SQL Server instance from which to remove the session-state components.
The database from which to remove the session-state components.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SessionStateType"></xref> values, specifying the type of session state to remove.
The type is `Custom` and the customDatabase value is not supplied, or the type is either `Temporary` or `Persisted` and the customDatabase value is not null.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Removes components for ASP.NET session state from a SQL Server database.
The database from which to remove the session-state components.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SessionStateType"></xref> values, specifying the type of session state to remove.
The connection string to use.
The connection string is only used to establish a connection to the database server.
Specifying a database in the connection string has no effect.
The type is `Custom` and the customDatabase value is not supplied, or the type is either `Temporary` or `Persisted` and the customDatabase value is not null.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Removes components for ASP.NET session state from a SQL Server database.
If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
**Note** The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
The SQL Server instance from which to remove the session-state components.
The user name to use when connecting to the database.
The password to use when connecting to the database.
The database from which to remove the session-state components.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SessionStateType"></xref> values, specifying the type of session state to remove.
The type is `Custom` and the customDatabase value is not supplied, or the type is either `Temporary` or `Persisted` and the customDatabase value is not null.
Unable to connect to the specified database server.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
